item.title: Traffic detector Occasionally comms do improve but not long enough to to gain ATC. Poor comms is being caused by a poor line sight from overgrown trees. Requires Council to cut back trees to improve line of sight. Please allow exception for Council to be contacted and tress cut back., 20th August
item.description:

item.title: Grid in pavement worn and rusty., 20th August
item.description:
Trip Hazard. Rusty and full of holes. Looks like it wouldn’t take much weight on it to cave in. Dangerous. This is on the opposite side of the road to Sainsbury’s Greenwich South Street, near the Zebra crossing and the corner of Royal Hill

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217-219, Greenwich High Road, London

item.title: Hygiene, Cleaning Standards and Security of Communal Stairs, 20th August
item.description:
A complaint regarding the communal stairs in our building, at Fellows Court Weymouth Terrace, E2 8LA. Right end entrance of the building, closest to Haggerston School. For two weeks now, there is a strong and persistent stench of urine! Needs cleaning!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Weymouth Terrace, Hackney, London

item.title: Illegal Poster, 19th August
item.description:
On North Cray Road, Bexley: Please could you remove an illegal poster advertising plumbing services on a Council’s street light column (heading from Bexley Village towards Sidcup). I had already reported this on here however your contractor has marked my report as being resolved when it hasn’t. Please remove it. https://fix.bexley.gov.uk/report/8034879
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Cray Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
